subject: Re: [junit] Running Junit tests with several JREs within another test
msgSnippet: Elliotte, Sometimes I would just trust that System.exit does what it says, and leave the little method untested.  I d do this most often in exception handling
messageBody:
Elliotte,

Sometimes I would just trust that System.exit does what it says, and
leave the little method untested. I'd do this most often in exception
handling code, where I don't have strong customer input about the right
thing to do, but still want to have defined behavior.

On the other hand, if adding the exit was because of an explicit
customer request or bug report, I'd probably add a shell script to my
system ("customer") tests, outside of JUnit, to make sure that I'd
captured the bug and the fix. I haven't done this for System.exit yet,
but I have for other behavior only observable from the command line.

David Saff

Elliotte Harold wrote:

> David Saff wrote:
> > Elliotte,
> >
> > Was this note in response to the original post, or James's latest
> > comment? Thanks,
> >
>
> The latest comment I think, about adding an exit method that could be
> overridden so you could test the overriding method but not the one the
> software actually used.
>
> --
